In stark contrast, the United States operates only two heavy icebreakers, both of which rely on conventional propulsion.The newest addition to Russia’s nuclear icebreaker fleet, the Project 22220 Yakutiya, began sea trials this week. It joins three other vessels of the same class, along with four older nuclear-powered icebreakers, with two of them dating back to the Soviet era. Three additional Project 22220 icebreakers are currently in development.

Title: 🇺🇸⚡️- The US Supreme Court has begun arguments today on what is...
Description: 🇺🇸⚡️- The US Supreme Court has begun arguments today on what is expected to be a landmark decision on transgenderism in United States v. Skrmetti. The case is over Tennessee's ban on trans surgery for minors which was passed after heavy lobbying by Matt Walsh and conservative activists.The ACLU and the Biden Administration are arguing the ban violates the 14th Amendment. The ACLU lawyer, a trans named Chase Strangio is the first trans person to ever argue in front of the Supreme Court.In 2020 the last time a trans rights case was before the Court, they ruled 6-3 in favor of the ACLU agreeing that Civil Rights protections in hiring practices applied to transgenders.So far this morning the Conservative Justices are more reserved in their questioning of Strangio while the Liberal Justices Sotomayor, Jackson, and Kagan are bouncing off each other in heavily attacking Mathew Rice, the lawyer arguing in favor of Tennessee's law. Rice is holding his ground against them refusing to give up Tennessee's arguments.

While SNA outlets and anti-Assad outlet, 'LiveUkraineMap', claim the entire… 🇷🇺🇺🇦 - In reference to the comment made regarding the source 'LiveUkraineMap'. Those who follow the Russia-Ukraine conflict would already be aware, it's notorious for fabricating claims, and does so on purpose. It's a very unreliable source.For instance, on its current map, it has Russia at Borova gates. A vital city on the Oskol river. These are advances not even Russia claims. They are painted red, then a week or so later, a made-up Ukrainian counterattack repels Russia to the actual front-lines. Of course, there was no counterattack, as Russian forces weren't even there. In this way it makes it seem Ukraine is re-gaining territory.

Title: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - WHY THE CEASEFIRE IS A DEFEAT FOR HEZBOLLAH / AXIS OF ...
Description: 🇱🇧🇮🇱 - WHY THE CEASEFIRE IS A DEFEAT FOR HEZBOLLAH / AXIS OF RESISTANCE:One cannot begin to unravel the timeline of the Third Lebanon War without going back further than October 8th, when Hezbollah began attacking northern Israel in support of Hamas. This began years ago, when Mossad implanted explosive devices inside pagers and walkie-talkies for Hezbollah operatives.What has been clear since October 7th is that Israel (more specifically, Netanyahu and his far-right coalition) knew that October 7th was actively being planned years in advance. They knew Hamas was going to attempt a large-scale incursion into Israel in an attempt to inflict as much damage as possible and, more importantly, court sympathy and intervention from the rest of the Middle East.Supporters / sympathizers of the Axis of Resistance (what we like to call -resistards-) like to frame the entirety of the Israel issue as one of Zionism, rather than the instinctual nature of the Jews to subvert and deceive their enemy until total victory is obtained. Anti-Zionism does not adequately explain the behaviors of Israel, but true recognition of the Jewish problem explains the behavior of Israel as well as the behavior of Jews.As Israel knew Hamas was planning October 7th, the pager explosions and the evidence that has emerged surrounding that event prove that Israel knew Hezbollah would get involved on Hamas' behalf. There is no other explanation for this intricate level of planning and execution other than preknowledge. Israel - more specifically, the Mossad - is the kingpin of preknowledge, and it doesn't just apply to Israel's proximate wars in the Middle East.An organization as dangerous and threatening as Hezbollah, in the eyes of Israel, is not to be left unscrutinised. It's plausible, if not definite, that Hezbollah has been, for many years, infiltrated through-and-through by Israeli spies, who may not tamper with the activities of Hezbollah, but feed knowledge to Tel Aviv on circumstantial and topical threats to Israeli security.If Israel knew Hamas was going to attack Israel on October 7th, which they did, then Israel most certainly knew Hezbollah would get involved as well. There is no debate.The only thing up for debate is how much worse it will get for the Axis of Resistance. Netanyahu made it clear in his speech today that Iran is the next target. The incoming Trump administration will give Netanyahu whatever he wants with regards to bringing Iran to its knees.The ceasefire being put into place today ends the Lebanon front for good. It's highly unlikely that Hezbollah will start shooting again. It's leadership has been decapitated, and while it's military strength has been tested, it hasn't been destroyed. In short- Hezbollah is still functional as an organization, and it hasn't lost its ability to threaten Israel, but the ceasefire being put in place makes Hezbollah a non-threat, at least for the time being. Israel has achieved its objective- they haven't destroyed Hezbollah, but pacification via a ceasefire arrangement is a victory for Israel nonetheless. Any statements to the contrary from -resistards- is a coping mechanism.It's hard to tell what else Israel has planned in terms of detailed strategy, but Iran is next on the chopping block. Trump will give Netanyahu whatever resources he needs to confront Iran. Iran had its chance to prevent this from happening, but it seems that Iran's existence will be put to the test in the coming months.

Title: 🔁 Reportedly Key Points of the Israel-Lebanon Agreement. •No Off...
Description: Forwarded From Lebanon News & OSINT 🇱🇧Reportedly Key Points of the Israel-Lebanon Agreement.•No Offensive Actions: Hezbollah and all other armed groups in Lebanon will cease offensive actions against Israel, and Israel will not carry out military attacks in Lebanon—on land, air, or sea.•Commitment to UN Resolution 1701: Both Israel and Lebanon reaffirm their commitment to the UN Security Council’s Resolution 1701, which emphasizes maintaining peace and stability in the region.•Right to Self-Defense: Both nations retain their inherent right to defend themselves if attacked.•Weapons Control: Only Lebanon’s official army and security forces will be allowed to carry weapons and operate in southern Lebanon. Any other armed groups will be disarmed, and unauthorized military facilities or weapons caches will be dismantled.•Oversight and Enforcement: A joint committee, agreed upon by both countries, will oversee compliance with the agreement. Any violations will be reported to this committee and to UNIFIL.•Border Security: Lebanon will deploy its army and security forces along all borders and crossing points in the south to ensure stability.•Israeli Withdrawal: Israel will gradually pull back its forces from south of the Blue Line within 60 days.•Future Negotiations: The U.S. will facilitate indirect talks between Israel and Lebanon to finalize a mutually agreed-upon land border.

Description: 🇮🇷🇱🇧🇮🇱 - Speculation from admin: This is an unusually high volume of fire for Hezbollah, demonstrating both their still ever-present threat against Israel and the as of now relative failure of Israel's invasion into Lebanon.We wonder if possibly Hezbollah is - in a sense - -preparing the way- for a future Iranian attack on Israel in retaliation to -Days of Repentance,- the codename for Israel's strikes inside Iran just under a month ago.Activating Israeli air defense systems, Iron Dome, and possibly other interceptors may deplete their stockpile of interceptors, making it easier for Iran to deal more damage in any future operation against Israel.
